page.title: 07LEISURE IN LOCAL VILLAGES
page.content: Leisure amenities and activities in the villges are somewhat limited due to the small size of the settlements. Questionnaires returned indicated that the local people would like to see more leisure provision in their villages, but they did not, however, want to see their villages spoilt. Peterborough city centre is the most commonly used area for leisure facilities, with many people also travelling to Orton Centre for its sports facilities. The number of facilities available locally has declined dramatically in recent years due to changing population make-up and increasing mobility. Those who have suffered most from these changes are the old and the immobile who have to rely on an inadequate public transport service to travel to nearby leisure facilities.
